definition: to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: I cannot digest all this information.
sentences.chinese: 我不能將所有的信息融會貫通。

sentences.english: It studies the book methodology concentrated expression is"achieves mastery through a comprehensive study"the thought and the method.
sentences.chinese: 其學書方法論集中表現爲“融會貫通”的思想和方法。

sentences.english: Jedi Knight's attunement to the Force more than compensates for these compromises.
sentences.chinese: 絕地武士對原力的融會貫通更能彌補這些不足。

sentences.english: He believes understanding, rather than memorization, is the most important part of studying.
sentences.chinese: 他相信學習之道在乎融會貫通，而非強記背誦。

sentences.english: Do not count on last minute cramming right before exams to do well.
sentences.chinese: 不要考試前的最後工夫裏靠融會貫通去取的好成績。

definition: different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
